bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Untied States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Antonio Bisegna, alias Disegna, for Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2679. Reply:
Comes now the petitioner and replies to the affirmative defense of the answer and return to the petition and writ herein as follows:

I. Petitioner denies that he was given a fair and impartial hearing on January 26th, 1914 or at all, according to the Immigration laws of the United States, but on the other hand was deprived of his right without due process of law as guaranteed under the constitution and laws of the United States.

II. Petitioner denies that the inspectors's recommendation marked "Exhibit A" and attached to said writ was fairly and impartially deduced from the testimony, and this petitioner denies that said testimony and recommendation or findings in any way show that the petititoner is likely to become a public charge, but show to the contrary.
III. As a further reply to said affirmative defense, this petitioner alleges:

That said order of deportation marked "Exhibit E" and annexed to said writ is illegal and insufficient in that it provides for the deportation and return to Italy instead of the country whence he came as shown in the testimony.
Wherefore, petitioner prays as set forth in his petition herein.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In the Matter of teh Application of Antonnio Bisegna, alias Disegna, for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the U.S. District Court Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division FEB 21 1914 Frank L Crosby, Clerk. By EML Deputy
Service of papers in this case may be made upon Alfred H. Lundin and Louis E. Shela, Attorneys for Petitioner at No. Street Room 811 Lowman Bldg., Block Seattle, Washington.
Lowman & Hanford Co., Seattle, Wash. - Form No. 198
